div1.p: Legation of the United States to the Department. Translation

Following the instruction received from my government, I have the honor to pull your attention on the second article of the decree Sovereign- King of the Independent State of the Congo, on the use of flags, decree on the date of April 30th 1889 and published in the 6 No 5 of the official bulletin May 1st -1887
According to the interpretation to give to this article, it is prescribed to all private boats navigating in the waters of the Independent

State of the Congo will have falls from Léopoldville, to display, at the back, the flag of the State. If it possesses the vessel's papers establishing its foreign nationality, it will be able to display, in addition, the flag of its country.

According to the second article of the General Act of the Conference of Berlin, all the flags, without distinction of nationality have free access to all the caux of the Congo and of its affluents, including the lakes, as well as all the that could be excused in the future with the goal of between them the waterways or the lakes included in all the expanse of the territories described in the 1st article of this Act.
